text.p: Den Danske Bank share analysts on Thursday said they downgraded Danish engineering and cement group FLS Industries stock to a "match minus" rating from "outperform".

"Lower FLS' Smith-Fuller Engineering unit order books last year than in 1995 coupled with reduced growth expectations in its key Far East market cause us to downgrade our FLS Industries recommendation to 'match minus' from 'outperform'," the analysts write in their latest stock survey.
They said that the "match minus" rating meant that the FLS Industries share was expected to perform up to five percent worse than the market as a whole.
At the same time FLS' EPS 9earnings per share) ratings were cut by nine percent in 1996 to 44.7, 19 percent this year to 55.2 and 23 percent to 62.8 in 1998.
The FLS Industries share traded 11 crowns down at 859 at 0950 GMT. --Joern Nurkka, Copenhagen newsroom +45-33969655
